basics.name: Zach (Xizhe) Hao
basics.label: Graduate Student in Electrical and Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Graduate student in Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Washington, specializing in Human-Computer Interaction, Wearable Computing, and Embedded Systems. Research focus on interaction techniques, AI-assisted development tools, and augmented reality.

work.name: Ubicomp Lab, University of Washington
work.summary: Investigating mechanically mediated sensing structures in ring and watch form factors to enable expressive, low-cost wearable input without reliance on complex ML models.
highlights: Implemented synchronized multi-channel firmware on Seeed XIAO nRF52840 using Arduino
Developed Python-based BLE data pipeline for real-time buffering and visualization
Trained lightweight Conv1D classifiers for gesture recognition analysis
Contributed to IRB and study design for human-subject evaluation

work.name: Iyer Lab, University of Washington
work.summary: Co-designed CircuitSync, integrating circuit schematics with embedded code to enable synchronized, LLM-assisted design and debugging.
highlights: Implemented JSON-based synchronization layer between visual circuit diagrams and structured data
Developed backend integration with Arduino CLI and multimodal prompting framework
Conducted 15-participant evaluation achieving SUS score of 78 (SD = 15.36)
Strong SPACE outcomes in productivity (M = 5.53) and learning (M = 5.07)

work.name: Makeability Lab, University of Washington
work.position: Graduate Research Assistant - AR Runner and GlanceAR
work.summary: Engineered iOS auditory AR system delivering head-tracked 3D 'ghost pacer' feedback via AirPods Pro 2.
highlights: Developed custom HRTF-based spatial audio engine using AVAudioEnvironmentNode
Implemented ARKit and Core Audio for spatialized audio cues
Designed LiDAR-based notification module for passive obstacle detection
Authored IRB protocol for human-subject evaluation

work.name: Shenzhen Suishi Technology Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Founded and led a six-member startup developing a WeChat Mini Program integrating campus discounts and local business services.
highlights: Reached 10K+ users across 3 universities
Achieved 100K+ post views with strong community engagement
Secured $1K seed funding and successfully exited at 3Ã— return (~$3K)
Managed technical development, data analytics, and promotional strategy

volunteer.summary: Coordinated 100+ members to manage the university's official social media and magazine.
highlights: Won 'Most Impactful University NewsWork' from China Youth Daily

publications.name: CircuitSync: Bridging Physical Context Gaps in AI-Assisted Embedded System Development
publications.summary: Englhardt, Z., Hao, X., Lin, T., Kao, C., Nissanka, D., Zhang, Z., Narayanswamy, G., Breda, J., Liu, X., Patel, S., Li, R., & Iyer, V. Manuscript submitted for publication at CHI 2026.

projects.name: Intelligent Fridge System
projects.summary: IoT-based smart refrigerator system that automatically tracks food items, monitors temperature and humidity, and issues expiry alerts through an online dashboard.
highlights: Image-based food recognition (YOLOv8)
Weight sensing and environmental monitoring
GPT-based recipe suggestion module

projects.name: Smart IoT-Based Plant Monitoring System
projects.summary: AI-driven IoT system integrating Raspberry Pi, multi-sensor modules, and GPT-based analysis for real-time plant monitoring and intelligent decision-making.
highlights: Closed-loop control for autonomous watering and fertilization
Cloud digital twin with Flask web dashboard
Awarded utility patent (CN220441530U)

projects.name: Caterpillar-inspired Soft Robot
projects.summary: PCB-based embedded control system for a bio-inspired soft robot driven by resistively heated liquid crystal elastomer (LCE) actuators.
highlights: MOSFET switching and thermal sensing
Real-time wireless control via Wi-Fi/Bluetooth
Programmable crawling locomotion
